meanings.definition: To push someone gently with your elbow in order to get their attention.
meanings.sent1: She gave her friend a nudge to show her the funny cat video.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to nudge the student to remind him to raise his hand before speaking.
meanings.sent3: During the movie, the sleepy boy received a nudge from his mom to stop snoring.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays gently nudged the flowers awake in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The gentle nudge of the wind guided the leaf to the ground.

meanings.definition: To encourage or persuade someone to do something in a subtle way.
meanings.sent1: He tried to nudge his brother into sharing the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The coach would nudge the players to give their best effort during the game.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel managed to nudge the bird out of its nest for a moment.
meanings.sent4: The idea of a new adventure nudged her to pack her bags and leave.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies always nudged him to the kitchen.
